history.content:
I took CS61B, CS70, and Math 54 in one semester and I wouldn't recommend a similar course load. CS70 is time consuming to understand the material with weekly homework while CS61B similar took a lot of time for projects and labs. With Math 54 on top of that, my coursework was heavy for me especially with needing to split my time when a project was due near midterms for my other two classes. Two of those classes would be fine but it really depends on how well you handle your coursework. I was a slow learner so this amount of coursework wasn't great for me.

~~~

You will almost certainly be miserable doing 61B, 70, and 53 together (although with just one other unit you'll probably survive?). Do not recommend. At all.

Even Hilfinger 61B (he's teaching next fall) and 70 together sounds bad enough. If you decide on doing 2 of those 3 techs 61B/70 is probably the hardest combo of those

EDIT: Another POV

I would say it depends greatly on your prior experience.  I know this class combo would generally be considered pretty tough, and I can't speak to 53 as I haven't taken it yet.  However, if you have significant prior experience with the kind of material 61B teaches (i.e. really excelled in APCSA+ some extra knowledge, more OOP/data structures focused) it should be easy, and for CS70 I think it's less about the material itself being hard, and more about a new way of thinking.  Most likely this will still be a tough course load, but on the other hand it's only 13 units.  I'd advise you to definitely look through some of the material for these classes first if you're not sure.

You could also begin with those classes for the first few weeks, and then see how you feel by the drop deadline.

EDIT: Yet Another

I did 61c, 70 and 53 in a semester, I wouldn't have done it if I wasn't completely sure about making the GPA cap.

-----------------------------

CS 61B with Hilfinger itself is not hard to get good grade (A+/A), since the tests are easy and they don't worth a lot of your grade. The only thing you need to pay special attention about is that his 61B has a very big project due in dead week (Thursday of that week I believe), and you need to sleep for one day after doing the project (so no Friday for review), which means that the project will eat up your dead week and you have almost no time to review other courses.

From my personal experience, I would recommend picking one of CS 70 or MATH 53 along with CS 61B, but not both, because you have almost no dead week.

I'm a freshman who's currently taking CS61A this spring. I'm considering taking either of the options this Fall:

  • CS61B, CS70, Math 53, 1 unit elective
  • CS61B, CS70, 5 other units either P/NP or a less competitive/easier graded course

I am pretty comfortable with CS61A so far and I am alright with math, however I heard that CS70 and Math 53 can be pretty tricky and the projects in CS61B are time-consuming. Either way, I would only be taking 13 units (to be considered full-time).

Has anyone else taken either CS61B + CS70, or all three of these at the same time and could share their thoughts, especially around midterm and finals seasons?
history.subject: Thoughts on taking CS61B + CS70 + Math 53 this Fall?
